storyInfo: Deszcz the attorney's business trip is heavily delayed by an unexpected vehicle breakdown. She spends the night in a village about to be sold for a rock-bottom price thanks to her own work, and gazes at a starry night sky forgotten by Kawalerielki.

attributes.content: November 28th, 5:00 P.M.
Southern Kazimierz, on a small road hard to traverse by car...
Mr. Młynar, please try a bit harder to remember.
attributes.name: Cheerful Female Voice

attributes.content: We've met before, when you and a representative from the Westland Company were bidding on a Gale Industries engineering contract!
attributes.name: Cheerful Female Voice

attributes.content: I told you, I don't remember.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: It would've been three years ago, when the Blood Knight won the Major! They were broadcasting the awards ceremony at the restaurant where they held the banquet after the auction.
attributes.name: Cheerful Female Voice

attributes.content: I've never paid any attention to those knight games.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Then do you remember toasting with every last representative from Gale Industries? You were pretty drunk by the end.
attributes.name: Cheerful Female Voice

attributes.content: I can remember it like it was yesterday. I never imagined it could be so difficult for the sales department of a large company to make a single deal.
attributes.name: Cheerful Female Voice

attributes.content: Considering the results, though, I'd say you got a pretty good deal yourself. At the time, a lot of our representatives were quite impressed with you, even though—
attributes.name: Cheerful Female Voice

attributes.content: Flattery will get you nowhere.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: We just happened to have crossed paths. You don't need to see this as a favor, nor should you expect me to ask for anything in return.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: How can you say that? If I hadn't met you, I'd still be wandering around lost in the wilderness!
attributes.name: Cheerful Female Voice

attributes.content: Look, I'm not trying to suck up to you - I really just wanted to thank you. After we get back to Kawalerielki, I swear I'll find a way to express my gratitude!
attributes.name: Cheerful Female Voice

attributes.content: If you still plan to make it back on time, then you'd best focus on the road and watch your step, Miss—
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Sorry, these heels are way too high, and it's hard to keep my balance...
attributes.name: Less-Cheerful Female Voice

attributes.content: ...Miss Deszcz.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: You'll have to forgive me for looking so unprofessional... Shoot, where'd my lip gloss go?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: At least I had the papers in a binder so they didn't get dirty.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Please, give me a minute to get my stuff back in order.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: ...Let's take a break here.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: O-Okay!
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I really am sorry about all this, Mr. Młynar. I wouldn't have had to bother you like this if my rental car hadn't broken down.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I only just drove it from the rental company to the hotel last night, and the engine was already dead by morning. I'm going to have to sue those guys for renting me a defective car!
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: By the way, if you ever run into any other little problems like that, I might be able to help you out! It's my area of expertise.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: ...I'm good.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Oh right, I still haven't told you about the case I'm working on.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: It concerns a little village called Twierdza. It was originally owned by a noble knight named Marek, who mortgaged the land to Gale Industries about seven years ago.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: But after that, he turned around and sold it to the villagers living there.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Naturally, they assumed they'd finally have the opportunity to own land, so they bought the farmland for ten years' worth of taxes.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: But half a year ago, Mr. Marek passed away to illness, and only then did Gale Industries put the development of Twierdza on the agenda. That's when we discovered that a lot of the titles had gone underwater.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: A good chunk of the villagers defaulted on the loans they took out years ago to buy the land, and were suddenly informed that it no longer belonged to them. Isn't that a bit outrageous?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: ...I don't recall asking you about any of this.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: I just thought you'd be interested in the dark underbelly of a business you're working with.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I don't need to hear yet another story of a lawyer seeking to right the world's wrongs.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Righting the world's wrongs? I certainly wouldn't say that... This is just my job.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: By the way, Mr. Młynar, why are you leaving Kawalerielki? Are you also on a business trip?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Vacation.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Oh, lucky you.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I don't even remember the last time I took a vacation. Maybe it was back when the Black Knight won the championship...?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I had money on that tournament, so I thought it'd be a good time to treat myself.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: But my earnings didn't actually add up to much.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: S-Sorry, I have to take a call real quick!
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Hello? I'm very sorry, I still haven't arrived at my destination, due to some unforeseen circumstances along the way.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Ah, no, don't worry, there won't be any delays. I swear I'll complete the negotiations by today and report back to the company.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Yes, yes, I'm fully aware that this was an error on my part, and I'm fully responsible for the consequences— Oh, they hung up.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: *Sigh*... The director's going to chew me out again when I get back... And I thought getting sent all the way out here was already bad enough.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: You said you were here to handle the suit regarding the acquisition of the village's land?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: That's right.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: But you mentioned something about 'reporting back to the company' over the phone?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: I think you're misunderstanding something, Mr. Młynar.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I am in charge of the land acquisition suit, but I represent Gale Industries.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Phew, we're finally here!
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Are you alright, Mr. Młynar? Should we find somewhere to rest?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Excuse me, are you Miss Deszcz, the attorney?
attributes.name: Man in a Suit

attributes.content: And you must be the attorney who contacted me earlier, Mr. Hamm.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Sorry for being so late. As you can see, there were some unexpected issues along the way.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: No worries. It's perfectly understandable, considering how far we are from Kawalerielki.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: So, Mr. Młynar, want to grab a drink after I'm all done with this? I hear the villagers here have a tradition of brewing beer.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I'll pass.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Mm, alright then! In that case, thanks for all the help!
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Miss Deszcz, can we get started right away?
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Oh, of course! Lead the way.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Good. Now, follow me please.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: (So, lawyers from big companies even take special attendants with them on business trips, huh?)
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: When I took the case, I thought I'd have to take the time to explain all the legal mumbo-jumbo to the residents, but I never thought they'd hire a lawyer of their own.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: The villagers turned to an NGO called the 'Kazimierzian Rural Dispute Mediation Association,' which sent me to deal with the situation here in Twierdza.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Great, having a professional on their side makes this much easier.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: But before we officially get started, Mr. Hamm, I'd like to make sure we're both on the same page.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: According to our prior communication, you've already informed the residents about the ownership dispute over Twierdza's land, and everyone has agreed to the demolition of the village.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Correct. I also reached out to Mr. Marek's sole heir: his son, Mr. Marek Jr.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: He is currently serving as a campaign knight and has no interest in reclaiming ownership.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Though the legal dispute has not yet been satisfactorily resolved, our most urgent task is to provide relief to the villagers.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Furthermore, we hope that both parties will be able to privately reach a peaceful resolution, so as to avoid the complicated deliberation process of the National Council.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Naturally, time is of the essence. The quicker we can wrap this case up, the better.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: The villagers of Twierdza have authorized me to negotiate with Gale Industries on their behalf, and I promised to secure fair compensation for the demolition of Twierdza and their relocation.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: So with that said, let's start by discussing the plan proposed by the villagers.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: We hope that Gale Industries will allocate housing to each inhabitant at a ratio of 10:1, according to the area of arable land owned by each household, and compensate the demolition at 80,000 marks per household.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: May I ask how they arrived at these numbers?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: They were the result of a professional market valuation as well as collective discussion among the residents.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Considering the detriment the relocation will have upon their lives, as well as the strength of Gale Industries' financial position, I believe these numbers are fair to both parties.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Mm. Naturally, you have the right to offer your price in a negotiation. If you have nothing more to add, I'd like to present Gale's initial offer.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: We will provide housing within the city at a ratio of 3:1, according to the area of each person's residence, as well as 800 marks per household to compensate for the demolition.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Umm, if you couldn't hear me clearly, I can repeat that—
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Miss Deszcz, I don't think this is the time to be cracking jokes.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: This isn't a joke, Mr. Hamm.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: In that case, I suppose I'll have to start from the top and break down our valuation of Twierdza's land.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Let's hear it.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Let's compare it to the closest neighboring village, Strumykowo.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: The lord there made a deal to sell all his arable land to Mieszko, at a final price of 600,000 marks per hectare.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: In terms of the quality of the arable land, as well as geographical location, it is very comparable to Twierdza's. As such, that price should certainly serve us as a reference point.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Coincidentally, I also happen to be familiar with the sale you just mentioned. But isn't it too early to equate these two situations?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Please elaborate.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: First of all, despite the fact that both villages are the same distance from Kawalerielki, there is a road leading straight to Strumykowo, whereas Twierdza is only accessible via a long, rugged mountain trail.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: The two villages also differ significantly in terms of traversibility and accessibility. A large portion of the land in Twierdza is occupied by mountainous terrain.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Secondly, the 'quality of the arable land' you brought up is a fictitious concept. By conventional standards, it is more sensible to assess farmland by the value of the crops it produces.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: In Strumykowo, the village has a complete production line, from the planting and harvesting of grains to the processing of foodstuffs. The value of the land's output is indisputable.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: By contrast, Twierdza's main crop is hops, and the village's sole beer processing factory closed down months ago. Reportedly, the site also had serious problems with environmental pollution.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Therefore, any valuation of Twierdza must take into account the profitability of its crops as well as the detriment posed by its lack of accessibility.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: From a multifactor analysis, the land occupied by these two villages could hardly be more different. I fail to see how it can serve us as a 'reference point.'
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: There may be truth in what you say, but our claim for compensation does not arise solely from the value of the land itself.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: We must also take into account the fact that the villagers here will be forced to relocate, changing their way of life and requiring them to learn a new trade. It is primarily for this reason that they require compensation.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Mr. Hamm, I'm not sure if you've checked the statistics or not.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Ten years ago, there were 215 households in Twierdza, of which 85% were engaged in agricultural production, using 95% of the arable land.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: But as of right now, there are 137 households, with the two aforementioned metrics falling to 15% and 21% respectively.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: In other words, in light of the fact that most residents have already shifted to light industry and handicrafts as their main livelihood, the notion that Gale Industries has an obligation to compensate them just for living on arable land is...
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Perhaps a little unreasonable?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Even the smallest voices deserve to be heard.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Mr. Hamm, did you know that a little over ten years ago, you could still see newsstands and the like in the streets and alleyways of Kawalerielki?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: People who couldn't get their hands on a ticket for the knight competitions could only wait at these newsstands, hoping to get the results of the games from a paper hot-off-the-presses.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Of course. I was one of them, back in my teenage years.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: However, with the recent rise of intercity networks and logistics, you'll be hard-pressed to find a single newsstand in the city these days.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Tell me, did the people who used to run them for a living get a single bit of compensation from the government? Is that your idea of 'fair'?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I don't think your analogy is entirely appropriate here, but...
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Now that we're talking history, Miss Deszcz, you should also know that across the history of civilization, the endless annexation of land has always been a major destabilizing factor.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: When we settle on a price for the land here in Twierdza today, we will also be setting a reference point for other villages' land transactions in the years to come.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: If the National Council were to weigh in on this matter, do you think they would allow Gale Industries to buy Twierdza's land at such an absurdly low price?
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Mr. Hamm, you seem to be misunderstanding the fundamental issue at hand.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Gale is paying compensation, not buying the land. When you trace everything back, Mr. Marek's deal with Gale came first, while his deal with the villagers came afterwards.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: From a legal standpoint, we already own the land.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: While we have an obligation to compensate the residents out of social responsibility, your attempt to treat this as a payment for the land itself is completely unfounded.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Regardless... I'm afraid the villagers will find the meager sum you proposed to be quite unpalatable.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Of course, that was only our initial offer, and there is still room for negotiation. Even in the worst case scenario, both of us reserve the right to request arbitration from the National Council.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: But when that time comes, the judge will hear all the exact same arguments I've made today. How confident are you that you can fetch a higher price in court?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Hmm... That's, I...
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Then how about we reevaluate what a 'fair' compensation for the demolition and relocation would be?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: A toast to a successful negotiation! To a signed contract!
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Ch-Cheers...
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Pwaaah! I can't remember the last time I got to kick back and knock down a drink like this! Guess this business trip wasn't all bad.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Your business trip has been a total disaster for me though...
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Don't be so hard on yourself, Mr. Hamm. There's not a lawyer out there who wins all the time. Besides, this was just a private settlement. It's perfectly normal not to get everything you want.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Take it easy. A lawyer's career is long and meandering, so just keep working at it. All I know is, right here and now, the beer is amazing!
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: To be honest, Miss Deszcz, I've known your name for a long time now.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: The Red Wine once reported that you've never lost a case on defense. You're considered a gold-star attorney even among the many experts at the Longrein Law Firm.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: You're gonna make me blush, haha...
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: When I heard that you would be representing Gale in this case, I already knew it would be hard for me to gain any sort of advantage.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Nevertheless, I tried to prepare for the negotiation as best as I could, but... you're indeed more capable than I imagined.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: So there's something I'd like to ask you, Miss Deszcz.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: As an experienced professional, what do you think went wrong with my handling of the case?
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Oh, I can tell that you put a good amount of time into it, but all in the wrong direction...
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: The wrong direction?
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Alright, alright, enough talking about work. No discord, no concord! C'mon, bottoms up!
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Um, now that the contract has been signed... can you answer a question?
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: How much money do you stand to make from handling this case?
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: That's a fairly touchy subject, wouldn't you say? Well, why don't you take a guess?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Considering your reputation within Kawalerielki's legal circles, I'd guess at least 50,000 marks, if you can get the price down to within the expected margins?
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Try again.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: A hundred thousand?
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I don't even want to think about it then...
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Actually, Gale gave me one million marks to resolve this case. In other words, if I can get the price down below that, the rest of the money is mine.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Oh, but I'd still have to cough up for taxes.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I don't think I'll ever see that kind of money in my life...
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: But the most important thing is, the beer here is somethin' else! Gimme another mug, barkeep!
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Right away. The beer here uses our signature fermentation method. You won't taste this stuff anywhere else.
attributes.name: Young Bartender

attributes.content: Huh? Nowhere else?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Ma'am, can I interest you in talking business? I'd be willing to buy the recipe from you, just name your price.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I'm afraid I can't do that. Dad would never agree to it.
attributes.name: Young Bartender

attributes.content: Besides, even if I gave you the secret recipe, you wouldn't be able to do anything with it. This kind of beer can only be made with hops grown in Twierdza. If you like it so much, buy some extra to take with you!
attributes.name: Young Bartender

attributes.content: ...Also, the land here was just purchased by the General Chamber of Commerce. The next time you come, there might not be any hops left.
attributes.name: Young Bartender

attributes.content: Oh, what a pity...
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Miss Deszcz, do you think I have any chance of getting into Longrein?
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*... *cough*... Excuse me?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Sorry, I know I have a long way to go, but please, if you could put in a good word for me, even if it's just for an internship... I swear I'll give it my all!
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: And here I was thinking a well-intentioned lawyer representing these poor villagers would look down on a firm that specializes in corporate clients.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: No, I've never thought like that... A lawyer's job is to fight for their clients, no matter who they are. There's nothing I can say to that.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Even if it's to help large corporations squeeze out innocent and helpless civilians? There's no justice in that, is there?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I've been practicing law for five years now. Who still believes in justice in this day and age?
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Even if I rummaged through all those massive codices of law, I doubt I'd find a single mention of the word.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Actually, I do remember this saying from a book on legal theory... How did it go again? Laws only bring absurdity, never justice...
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: 'The notion that justice can be achieved through manmade laws is absurd on its face.'
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Right, right! That's the one!
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Not to mention, how can a small-time lawyer like me... How can I even afford a decent place to live in Kawalerielki? What do you think...? Miss Deszcz?
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Huh? Oh, sorry, I spaced out a little.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I was just thinking, if that nice girl knew that I'm the cold-hearted lawyer who squeezed them out of their compensation money, would she kick me out of the bar?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: My bad, I think I've had a bit too much to drink. I need to go outside and cool off, so let's talk about all this work stuff later.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: She lifts her head and suddenly realizes how out-of-place her long breaths seem.
The quiet night shrouds her, as if she's remembering for the first time to pull down the curtains to block the never-ending stream of lights.
So you can still see the stars outside of Kawalerielki...
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: How many years has it been since I last saw a starry sky?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Hello everyone. My name is Deszcz, and today, I'll be starting as a novice lawyer-in-training.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: This is my first-ever case. Starting today, I'll use everything I know to uphold the dignity of the law and protect justice!
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: (Hey, why is everyone laughing... Did I say something I shouldn't have?)
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: It really has been... so many years.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Oh, Mr. Młynar, you're still here!
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Thank goodness! I've been busy all day and was worried that you already left and I wouldn't get a chance to thank you.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: ...There was an incident along the highway, and they had to temporarily block the road.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Also, don't forget your things next time.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Oh, that's the ID badge on my work uniform... Wait, when did the strap break? Was it when I fell down earlier?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Someone took note of you.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Eh?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Ah, ahaha... Th-thank you! I guess that means you saved my hide again...
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: You seem to be in a good mood. Did you secure a good price for Gale?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: It was a passable deal, ahaha... Um, do you also think I'm an unethical lawyer?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: You'd never hear such naive, senseless words out of my mouth.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: ...There's something I'd like to ask you.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Did you know that after that bidder conference back then, our rival Westland Company was sued for serious defects in their construction materials?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: ...I might've seen something like that in the papers.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Even in a place like Kawalerielki where it isn't uncommon to cut corners in the construction industry, the reporter still gave it a full page article.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Then you throw in the fact that the National Council slapped enough fines on them to bankrupt them. People are going to remember that.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: You really do know your stuff, huh... Or rather, you knew all along, didn't you?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: You knew how Westland operated, which is why you spared no effort trying to secure the contract. So they wouldn't get the hospital construction project.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: ...I didn't expect to hear such naive, senseless words from a seasoned attorney.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Naive?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I have no idea how you came to such a ridiculous conclusion, so I'll just assume you were trying to insult me.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Sorry, not at all! I was just trying to make small talk.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: ...It's getting late. I'll be heading back now.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: You're not going to try the specialty beers here?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I never liked drinking.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: I just wanted someone to chat with, but looks like I said something I shouldn't have again...
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Deszcz slowly walks towards the not-so-vast farmland by the side of the road.

After the autumn harvest, the fields of straws were neatly pressed down, resembling an all-natural mat. The aroma of hops coalesces with the scent of the humid air, leaving a deep impression in her nostrils.
She lies down and extends a finger, gesturing at the stars in the sky as if searching for something.
Where are the stars that make up Libra right now?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Hello? Yes, it's me. There's nothing to worry about - there were no issues in signing the contract.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I'm very sorry, but it's too late for me to return to Kawalerielki tonight. Mm, yes, you may deduct the extra day from my annual leave.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I assure you, there will be no further delays, and I'll submit the contract to the company— Oh, hung up again...
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Jeez... I just wanted to gaze at the stars in peace...
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Maybe it's time I changed things up a little.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Miss Deszcz, I still have some things to attend to here, so I won't be seeing you off.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: I've learned a lot from our negotiations. Thank you very much.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: You're too humble, seriously. If I ever see you back in Kawalerielki, I'll take you out for another drink!
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I should probably be the one picking up the tab next time...
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Oh, and one more thing... About the Longrein Law Firm...
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: That's still on your mind, huh? To be honest, it's not like I can't give you a recommendation.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: So how about I give you a simple examination first? Take a look at this.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: This is... the land sale contract between Mr. Marek and Gale?
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Take a closer look. Do you see any problems with it?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I don't see anything wrong with the terms, and the details are fairly comprehensive as well... Wait, the signing party isn't Mr. Marek, but rather his son?!
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: He was still alive at the time, and the contract provides no evidence that he ever authorized his son to act as his agent.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Marek Jr. should not have been eligible to sign this on his father's behalf.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: But that's not all... Marek Jr. is a campaign knight now, so why does he have so many dealings with Gale?
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: In other words... Based on this, Gale Industries has no claim to the land of Twierdza village!
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Not necessarily. After all, Mr. Marek has passed away, and Gale has countless other ways of backing up the transaction.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: But... this is a critical breakthrough in the case. Miss Deszcz, couldn't maliciously leaking confidential information like this... lead to disbarment?
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: I happened to accidentally lose some sensitive information at the site of the negotiation. How could that possibly be considered malicious?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I should've seen this coming...
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Actually, you should've requested these documents from Gale Industries at the very beginning of negotiations.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: They'll probably look for a way to cover it up, but it'll at least set them on the back foot.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: But failing to take this into consideration was an error on your part.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: So instead of making a fuss over the value of the land, I should've tried to challenge the legitimacy of Gale's claim in the first place.
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Is this what you meant when you said I went 'in the wrong direction'?
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: See? All you needed was a little hint. You're pretty sharp after all.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: For a lawyer, having the right evidence is akin to having a bullet. But you still need the right gun for it to be effective. So, Mr. Hamm, what do you plan to do next?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I'll need to think this through carefully...
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: I'll still submit the contract we already signed to Gale Industries. During that time, you can file a lawsuit with the National Council on the basis of newly discovered evidence.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: It doesn't matter whether you want to renegotiate the compensation or reject Gale's ownership of the land altogether.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Regardless of the final outcome, you can still put this whole experience on your resume. Then, you can try to talk to Longrein.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: But... why are you doing this?
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Why are you taking such a huge risk? To help the villagers here?
attributes.name: Hamm

attributes.content: Oh, don't get it twisted. I'm not that great of a person.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Just think of it this way: I'd like to have another opportunity to enjoy Twierdza's beer in the future.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Yes, these are the victims from the incident last night. A minibus bound for Dzwonek.
attributes.name: Village Messenger

attributes.content: Do you recognize this old man? That's strange... I've been delivering letters for decades, and I've never seen him send or receive anything.
attributes.name: Village Messenger

attributes.content: He's never even bought a paper before. Doesn't seem like an educator at all.
attributes.name: Village Messenger

attributes.content: By the way, want a copy of today's paper? Find out about what happened in the incident, for the low price of fifty Hellers.
attributes.name: Village Messenger

attributes.content: Word on the street is that some Infected was causing trouble, protesting about how they couldn't live in the city. Get a load of those thankless thugs. Who do they think let them in in the first place?
attributes.name: Village Messenger

attributes.content: Mr. Młynar!
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: My car's all fixed up now, but mind showing me the way again?
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: I'm heading to Dzwonek. It's not on the way to Kawalerielki.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Oh, I won't be going back to Kawalerielki for a while either.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: Hmm, heading to Dzwonek too doesn't sound so bad!
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: And what do you plan to do there?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: I don't have anything particular in mind yet.
attributes.name: Deszcz

attributes.content: But maybe I'll treat myself to a little vacation, and then... find a new job.
attributes.name: Deszcz
